cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ecosystems have and exhibit ecosystem functioning.

remarks: Relation created to capture that functioning is an attribute/process of ecosystems.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Relates an entity to an attribute, quality, state, or condition that characterizes it (e.g., stability, condition, health, resilience, or functioning).
args.justification: All these relations link ecosystems to their characterizing properties such as condition, stability, health, resilience, or functioning. The existing canonical_rel_name, rel_cls, and rel_cls_group are semantically consistent, but the description was too ecosystem-specific and slightly repetitive. This update generalizes and clarifies the predicate description while keeping the same schema pattern for all five instances.

executed_decisions.justification: All these relations link ecosystems to their characterizing properties such as condition, stability, health, resilience, or functioning. This update generalizes and clarifies the predicate description while keeping the same schema pattern for all five instances.
